caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 25.
Taira qiuae Wang, Jäger & Zhang, 2010
. A. Male habitus, dorsal view; B. Female habitus, dorsal view; C. Left male palp, prolateral view; D. Same, ventral view; E. Same, retrolateral view; F. Epigyne, ventral view; G. Same, dorsal view.

Diagnosis. This species resembles
T. zhui
by having a free standing and long retrolateral tibial apophysis on the male palp and long, more or less, anteriorly converging spermathecae in the epigyne ( Figs 25C, D ).
T. qiuae
, however, can be differentiated from
T. zhui
by the following: median apophysis L-shaped in
T. qiuae
( Fig. 25D ), whereas M-shaped in
T. zhui
; conductor pen nib-shaped ( Figs 25D, E ), whereas beak-shaped in
T. zhui
; spermathecae two times longer in
T. qiuae
( Fig. 25G ) than in
T. zhui
.

Description. See
Wang et al. (2010)
. Habitus, male palp and epigyne ( Fig. 25 ).
Distribution. China ( Chongqing , Gansu , Hubei , Shaanxi , Sichuan ) ( Fig. 28 ).
